channel.title: An idea for you guys?
channel.description:
I'm just thinking, you always want the most upto date client.. right? And then I'm thinking.. well who has that? RuneScape.
So here's my idea.
If we used a packet sniffer to gather the IP for one of RuneScape's servers (a specific world). Then edit the windows hosts file to re-direct all requests for that IP to the IP of the private server.
In essence, this would work for using a completely up-to-date client with no/little glitches?
I don't know if it's within the rules of what you guys to or whatever, it's just a suggestion, shouldn't really be hard either. I would try it myself, but I gave up on this scene once my HDD containing all my server died - unrecoverable.

item.title: An idea for you guys?
item.dc:creator: @CookieScape CookieScape
item.description:
@CookieScape wrote:

I’m 95% sure JaGeX protects Runescape against packet sniffers. They’re a multi million dollar company, they can do that.

Read full topic
